title: Carry me to gold
body:
Went from s2 - b1 in the last week after sitting comfortably in high silver all year.

I need some solid duo partners because yoloq is a nightmare right now - either feeders on my team or smurf duos on theirs.

Probably bottled any chance of gold with my epic loss streak, but I'm not giving up just yet.

Hit me up in game if you are keen to duo.

replies.body:
Requests for team recruitment are best posted in Team Recruitment: 
http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/team-recruitment

As such, I'll be closing this thread, but I do encourage you to repost there.

:\
That is very unfortunate to hear my friend, but I don't like the sound of how you plan to get back into your previous/higher elos.
I'll bet fat money that not *every* game is lost by either your feeding team mates or smurfs on the enemy's. Somewhere in the equation **you** must fit in. And being only silver/bronze, I'm guessing you play a significant role in this equation that is causing you to demote. 

I'm not trying to be nasty or call you a bad player or anything, there are games that are purely unwinnable of course, but I'm sure there are areas of your gameplay specifically that could do with improvement to give you a better chance of carrying/winning games, and therefore promoting back to your previous rating, if not higher. Yes, feeding team mates and smurfing enemies do make it very hard to win. In these circumstances, if the condition of a victory is bleak or non existent, just ignore whatever else is going on, and solely focus on self improvement. Try and take something away from each ranked game you play, and don't take them simply for win or lose; don't think of every game as either LP gain or LP loss. 

Ive had plenty of those games buddy you can trust me to know what I'm rambling on about. I've had games with Challenger/pro players smurfing on the enemy team, and games with people inting cause they didn't get X role that they wanted. There is nothing you individually can do to stop that happening, but there are things you can do individually to improve your own gameplay. Try focusing on doing that, rather than getting a party of 4 other players to just carry you. You don't learn anything or really improve at all that way bro.

Ultimately the decision is up to you, this is just purely my advice and opinion. However, I do hope you take the opportunity to heed my words tho. 
Regardless, good luck on the rift, and have a wonderful Sunday :)

Nah i hear what you are saying and ordinarily i would agree with you but statistically speaking i am playing reasonable lol right now and i haven't suddenly dropped 4 divisions because I started sucking all balls after 8 months sitting pretty in high Silver.

The fact is that team composition is vastly different in the lead up to end of season and i need a reliable duo to be able to compete with all the reliable duos.

>
> Nah i hear what you are saying and ordinarily i would agree with you but statistically speaking i am playing reasonable lol right now and i haven't suddenly dropped 4 divisions because I started sucking all balls after 8 months sitting pretty in high. Silver.
> 
> The fact is that team composition is vastly different in the lead up to end of season and i need a reliable duo to be able to compete with all the reliable duos.

You can't really say that you are not the problem. I was in a similar situation to you and I was stuck in b2 and I kept telling myself that my team was bad, that was why I was losing. The fact of the matter is that especially in lower elos such as silver and bronze you always can greatly improve in every area of your gameplay but the first step to improving is admitting that you need to improve. Again not calling you bad as I am roughly in the same elo as you but after actively noticing your mistakes and not blaming others you can really start to improve and climb.

the fact is that game and team composition has changed a lot in the lead up to end of season. That is undeniable.

This isnt a "I'm better than my rank" cry. I'm not saying I'm LoL god, but I'm saying that trying to SoloQ against premades is very hard, and there are more premades trying to get end of season rewards. 

These are undeniable facts.

All I am suggesting is that I'd like to level the playing field with a reliable premade of my own.

At bronze and silver luck has alot to do with it though. I'm silver 3 atm but I'm sure as hell not up to scratch for silver and I should probably be more mid bronze. I've just been carried consecutively, by pure chance, since I know the games I won, I just got carried. At least right now I'm on a losing streak because my lag lately is making me feed even harder than usual to points where it's no longer possible to carry me.
Edit: I pretty much only play soloq, 2 times I've played with friends but we lost both of those games.

From S2 to B3 in a 4 week losing streak.
FML so hard.

That sucks mate.. :( good luck on the slog back up!

I'm on 14 lp silver 5 atm, and op.gg says "my MMR is lower than average." _(due to playing too many duo games with my friends who are a lower rank then me.. yet are probably better then me)_

So I'm just like _"Yup i ain't gunna play ranked again this year"_
It took me all year to get BACK into silver again, and god forbid i should drop out of it just before the season ends...
To be honest i think gold is off the cards now. Will try cement myself in mid silver for the border.
